Articles.Content:
Kerbals are simple. Yet they are so fun. They are funny, they have personalities, they live, they die, but they are SO simple. They are a very simple set of rules and that's ALL they are.

This defines Kerbalkind in all of it's glory.

Rule number 1. All Kerbals like feeling weightless.
Rule number 2. Kerbal pilots enjoy high speeds, their passengers don't.
Rule number 3. Kerbal pilots don't mind spinning craft as much as their other passengers do.
Rule number 4. Stupid kerbals enjoy spinning to a certain extent.
Rule number 5. All kerbals panic at extreme spin.
Rule number 6. Brave kerbals regain their composure faster.
Rule number 7. Stupid Kerbals are quick to excite.

This defines a specific Kerbal.

Is he a "Recruit" or a "Crew"?
What is his name?
On a scale of 0 to 1, how brave is he?
On a scale of 0 to 1, how dumb is he?
Is he a Badass?
Is he Dead?
When will he sign up?

And here's a random name generator for the Kerbs if you don't want the game to make one for you.

 Kerbals all have randomly generated names with pseudo-randomly generated stats, with a 10% chance of having the badass stat, except for the three starting crew whose names and stats are fixed:

Jebediah Kerman, stupidity 50%, courage 50%, badass
Bill Kerman, stupidity 80%, courage 50%
Bob Kerman, stupidity 10%, courage 30%

1/20 chance of having a 'proper' name, chosen from a list
19/20 chance of name being prefix+suffix
all last names are Kerman

additionally, names containing the following are immediately rejected and a new name will be generated: "Kerbal", "Kerman", "eee", "rrr", and "Dildo"

Kerbals are mental parasites - they steal our brains through the computer screen and harness our thoughts to help them build rockets.
I feel stupid for asking, but how is a badass different?
They smile all the time. Except if their ship is exploding.

I thought I was going to have to strand Jebediah on Eve and my wife shouted at me, "NO! You save my little buddy!"

Yes, ma'am.

Yes, ma'am=PRICELESS

Do the same names generate badasses every time? Doodbro has popped up in a few saves and he's always a badass.

I try to balance personalities. A badass like Jeb, a worrier like Bill, and a screamer like Bob. Bob, not Jeb, is my favorite. I'm always glad to see him smile.

Also, I've noticed that 25k seems to be the threshold for when Kerbals stop freaking out from launch. Is that when weightless conditions kick in?
